Tree | blank1_info_sec1 = Japanese Chinquapin | blank2_name_sec1 = - Flower | blank2_info_sec1 = Scarlet Sage | blank3_name_sec1 = - Bird | blank3_info_sec1 = | blank4_name_sec1 = - Fish | blank4_info_sec1 = | blank5_name_sec1 = | blank5_info_sec1 = | blank6_name_sec1 = | blank6_info_sec1 = | blank7_name_sec1 = | blank7_info_sec1 = | blank_name_sec2 = Phone number | blank_info_sec2 = 0581-22-2111 | blank1_name_sec2 = Address | blank1_info_sec2 = 18 Imazawa-chō, Gifu-shi, Gifu-ken 500-8701 | website = | footnotes = }} is a city in the Chūbu region of Japan on the island of Honshu.Deal, William E. (2005). Handbook to Life in Medieval and Early Modern Japan, p. 70. It is the capital city of Gifu Prefecture.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Gifu" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 246; "Chūbu" at p. 126. It has been recognized as a core city since 1996.Jacobs, A.J. "Japan's Evolving Nested Municipal Hierarchy: The Race for Local Power in the 2000s," Urban Studies Research, Vol. 2011 (2011), p. 8 [PDF 8 of 14]; retrieved 2012-12-5. ==References== == Other websites == * http://www.city.gifu.lg.jp/c/19110106/19110106.html ; Category:Cities in Gifu Prefecture
title: Gifu
